title: Download ILSA files
text: Currently ILSAmerge able download several ILSA datasets, including: ‘PISA’, ‘TALIS’, ‘TIMSS’, ‘TIMSS Advanced’, ‘PIRLS’, ‘ICCS’, ‘ICILS’, ‘CIVED’, ‘REDS’, ‘RLII’, ‘SITES.’ links datasets allocated GitHub, links can corrected . availableILSA(), can check datasets available:

what: Download the datasets for a particular study
title: Download ILSA files
text: Depending study datasets uploaded 1 .zip files. ILSAdownload() handle many .zip files download. example, let us say want download data ‘RLII’ 1991. , least need opt three arguments; study, year, outputdir: can see, studies require agree license agreements. case, required answer agree . order continue, need agree. know agree study terms, can also avoid prompt via agreeLicense = TRUE:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir()) ## By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. ## License Agreement downloaded. ## Do you agree with these terms and conditions? ## Please answer TRUE or FALSE. ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              agreeLicense = TRUE) ## By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. ## 1 files found for RLII 1991. ## Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.

title: Download ILSA files
text: function can also unzip downloaded files using unzip = TRUE:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              unzip = TRUE)

title: Download ILSA files
text: possible avoid printing quiet = TRUE, still prompted agree. avoid prints can use arguments:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              quiet = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE)

title: Download ILSA files
text: Timeout times downloading controlled maxtime, can set desired number seconds:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              maxtime = 60)

title: Load ILSA files
text: Using ILSAfile.info() can identify different populations within ILSA. Moreover, can also use information loading specific population memory. Using ‘REDS’ 2021 example data provided package:
code: ILSAfile.info(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")) ##   Population Files  MB ## 1      BCGV1     4 0.3 ## 2      BSGV1     4 0.4 ## 3      BTGV1     4 0.3

title: Merge ILSA files
text: example, can use data ‘REDS’ 2021 provided package. case ‘REDS’ 2021, 12 files 3 populations: ILSAmerge() can combine files number populations . default type “rds”, also can make “zsav” “sav” files:
code: ILSAfile.info(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")) ##   Population Files  MB ## 1      BCGV1     4 0.3 ## 2      BSGV1     4 0.4 ## 3      BTGV1     4 0.3 ILSAmerge(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),            outputdir = tempdir(),            filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"))

title: Merge ILSA files
text: Depending goals capabilities computer, may consider adjusting options ILSAmerge(): population: need merge populations path, include character vector. format output ILSAfile.info(). MBlimit: set NULL, default, files merged within R. set numeric value establish limit (output ILSAfile.info()) files going merged R, populations go limit merged R, instead SPSS syntax produced. Later, can use syntax merge files. MBlistlimit: ILSAmerge() files merged two ways: using list produced lapply function, empty matrix filled subscripts. first method almost always faster, can use lot memory. argument establishes limit merging list matrix. recommend setting higher 200. SPSSlimit: SPSS syntaxes going produced important take account SPSS requirements handling files. vary SPSS version, normally total 50 files per command.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: ILSAmerge() runs, information progress merging running time produced:
code: ILSAmerge(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),            outputdir = tempdir(),            filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav")) ## 12 files detected. Merging into 3 files. ## Merging BCGV1. Type 1 of 3. ## Merging dataset 1 of 4. ## Merging dataset 2 of 4. ## Merging dataset 3 of 4. ## Merging dataset 4 of 4. ## Merging BCGV1 took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes. ## Merging BSGV1. Type 2 of 3. ## Merging dataset 1 of 4. ## Merging dataset 2 of 4. ## Merging dataset 3 of 4. ## Merging dataset 4 of 4. ## Merging BSGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. ## Merging BTGV1. Type 3 of 3. ## Merging dataset 1 of 4. ## Merging dataset 2 of 4. ## Merging dataset 3 of 4. ## Merging dataset 4 of 4. ## Merging BTGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. ## Merging took 1 seconds or 0.01 minutes.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: merging countries also possible merge datasets different respondents. Two functions available merge respondents: combineStudents(), addSchools.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: combineStudents() combines multiple student files, e.g., achievement background questionnaires, using ‘TIMSS’ Advanced 1995: can see, new file created combining achievement student questionnaire.
code: # Path were raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/timssadv", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path were merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"combineStudents")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"combineStudents")  # Merging 'TIMSS' Advanced 1995, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = TRUE)  # Rename files ILSArename(output) ## 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) found. ## 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) renamed.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  # Combine student files combineStudents(inputdir = output, outputdir = output) ## 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() student file(s) found. Combining into 1 file(s). ## Combining student 1 of 1. ## Combining students took 0 seconds or 0 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  ## [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"

title: Merge ILSA files
text: addSchools() adds school data student teacher files, using ‘TIMSS’ Advanced 1995: can see, new file created combining information students schools.
code: # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  ## [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"  # Add school data addSchools(inputdir = output, outputdir = output) ## 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() file(s) found. Adding schools to 1 file(s). ## Combined students found for MSAM1. ## Adding schools to MSAM1, file 1 of 1. ## Adding schools took 0 seconds or 0 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  ## [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"             ## [5] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student&school.rds"

text: can also combine steps preparing ILSA data (downloading, merging, combining respondents, renaming) using ILSAready().

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: Downloads 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). functions supports following ILSA: 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES.' Depending study, need decide data download, read accept terms conditions proceed download.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
code: ILSAdownload(   study,   year,   outputdir = getwd(),   unzip = FALSE,   maxtime = 999,   quiet = FALSE,   agreeLicense = FALSE )

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: study string indicating name study. available studies check description function. year numeric value indicating year study. outputdir directory data downloaded. unzip logical value indicating files unzipped. Default FALSE. maxtime numeric value indicating maximum time allowed downloading file. Default 999. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE. agreeLicense logical value indicating agree Disclaimer License Agreement file www.iea.nl. FALSE, prompted agree else data downloaded. Default FALSE.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: Saves 'SPSS' ILSA data locally.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
code: # For example, to download 'RLII' 1991 data:  # Path where files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAdownload")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAdownload")   # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = output, unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: Merges 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). function tested behave correctly : 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' (2006).

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
code: ILSAmerge(   inputdir = getwd(),   outputdir = getwd(),   population = NULL,   filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"),   MBlimit = NULL,   MBlistlimit = 200,   SPSSlimit = 50,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. outputdir directory merged data saved. population character vector indicating files merged. NULL (default), files merged. information available populations, run ILSAfile.info() first. filetype string indicating type file saved, can "rds", "zsav", "sav". MBlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type (see ILSAfile.info()). type files go limit, files merged R, 'SPSS' syntax produced via spss.syntax(). set NULL, limit used files merged within R. speed problem, recommend number 200 merge rest 'SPSS'. Beware ILSA files different columns cause 'SPSS' syntaxes fail. happens, merge R. MBlistlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type merging list. Values limit merged matrix, slower uses less memory. Default 200. SPSSlimit numerical value indicating limit files per command 'SPSS', typically 50. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: Saves merged ILSA data .sps syntax merging ILSA data.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: files merged within R also add country information needed. Country information retrieved 'GitHub' possible. , use package internal data.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path where merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAmerge")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAmerge")  # Merging 'REDS' 2021, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = FALSE) #> 12 files detected. Merging into 3 files. #> Merging BCGV1. Type 1 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BCGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging BSGV1. what: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
text: Downloads ILSA data, merges , combines students adds school information. function wrapper ILSAdownload, ILSAmerge, ILSArename, combineStudents, addSchools. see ILSA available function use availableILSA. data already downloaded can use ILSAreadylocal.

title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
code: ILSAready(   study,   year,   outputdir = getwd(),   filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"),   MBlistlimit = 200,   quiet = FALSE,   agreeLicense = FALSE )  ILSAreadylocal(   inputdir = getwd(),   outputdir = getwd(),   filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"),   quiet = FALSE,   MBlistlimit = 200 )

title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
text: study string indicating name study. available studies check description function. year numeric value indicating year study. outputdir directory merged data saved. filetype string indicating type file saved, can "rds", "zsav", "sav". title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: Load 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA), including: 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' (2006) list.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
code: justload(   inputdir = getwd(),   population,   justattributes = FALSE,   addcountries = FALSE )

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. population character value indicating files loaded. information available populations, run ILSAfile.info() first. justattributes logical value indicating 0 rows loaded. can used just need check column attributes. Default FALSE. addcountries logical value indicating country information added elements list. means adding variable CNTRY needed adding labels IDCNTRY needed. FALSE (default), data loaded . Country information retrieved 'GitHub' possible. , use package internal data.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: list tibbles.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Load only attributes emptylist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", justattributes = TRUE)  # Load complete data fulllist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", justattributes = FALSE)  # Load complete data and add country labels withcou <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", addcountries = TRUE)

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: Produces saves 'SPSS' merge syntax given list files.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
code: spss.syntax(filelist, name, outputdir = getwd(), zsav = TRUE, SPSSlimit = 50)

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: filelist character vector list files merged. name string name merged file (without extension). outputdir directory .sps file merged file saved. zsav logical value indicating merged file compressed zsav. Default TRUE. SPSSlimit numerical value indicating limit files per command 'SPSS', typically 50.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: Saves .sps file 'SPSS' syntax merging desired files.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path where merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"spsssyntax")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"spsssyntax")  # List of BCGV1 files to be merged files <- list.files(path = input, pattern = "BCG.+V1|bcg.+v1")  # Create 'SPSS' syntax spss.syntax(filelist = files, name = "BCGV1", outputdir = output, zsav = TRUE)

title: Untibble — untibble
text: Converts tibble plain data frame column attributes.

title: Untibble — untibble
code: untibble(tibble, mistoNAs = FALSE)

title: Untibble — untibble
text: tibble tibble object list tibbles. mistoNAs logical value indicating missing values converted NAs. Default FALSE.

title: Untibble — untibble
text: tibble.

title: Untibble — untibble
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Load complete data fulllist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", justattributes = FALSE)  # Untibble first element unt1 <- untibble(fulllist[[1]])  # Untibble all list unt2 <- untibble(fulllist)

title: ILSAmerge 1.3.5
text: Fixed issue saving ‘SPSS’ files. Added new functions tibble management: asthistibble(), get.atr(), get.nas(), get.varlab(), mistoNAs(), untibble(), whichcol().

title: ILSAmerge 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-26 Added ILSAready() ILSAreadylocal() wrappers downloading, merging, combining respondents, renaming.

title: ILSAmerge 1.3.0
text: unzip PISA TALIS downloads.

title: ILSAmerge 1.2.5
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-21 Added combineStudents() combining achievement background questionnaires. Added addSchools() adding school data. Added labels countries creates variables country codes country names.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.5
text: Added ILSArename() creating comprehensible file names. Fixed problem caused PIRLS 2021 empty dataset. Fixed problem merging dates TIMSS 2011. Fixed problem originated PIRLS 2001 multiple capitalization styles.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.1
text: Added extensive new documentation. Added availableILSA() check ILSA can downloaded.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-08 CRAN submission. Added PISA TALIS ILSAdownload(). ILSAdownload() connects GitHub check recent links.

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.4
text: Fixed internal argument checks. Added ILSAdownload() downloading ILSA ‘SPSS’ datasets.

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.1
text: Added justload() load files list merge save .

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.0
text: Initial version
